00013 /*      Upscaling the image uses simple bilinear interpolation  */
00014 int
00015         up_scale_image
00016         (
00017                 const unsigned char* const orig,
00018                 int width, int height, int channels,
00019                 unsigned char* resampled,
00020                 int resampled_width, int resampled_height
00021         )
00022 {
00023         float dx, dy;
00024         int x, y, c;
00025 
00026     /* error(s) check   */
00027     if (        (width < 1) || (height < 1) ||
00028             (resampled_width < 2) || (resampled_height < 2) ||
00029             (channels < 1) ||
00030             (NULL == orig) || (NULL == resampled) )
00031     {
00032         /*      signify badness */
00033         return 0;
00034     }
00035     /*
00036                 for each given pixel in the new map, find the exact location
00037                 from the original map which would contribute to this guy
00038         */
00039     dx = (width - 1.0f) / (resampled_width - 1.0f);
00040     dy = (height - 1.0f) / (resampled_height - 1.0f);
00041     for ( y = 0; y < resampled_height; ++y )
00042     {
00043         /* find the base y index and fractional offset from that        */
00044         float sampley = y * dy;
00045         int inty = (int)sampley;
00046         /*      if( inty < 0 ) { inty = 0; } else       */
00047                 if( inty > height - 2 ) { inty = height - 2; }
00048                 sampley -= inty;
00049         for ( x = 0; x < resampled_width; ++x )
00050         {
00051                         float samplex = x * dx;
00052                         int intx = (int)samplex;
00053                         int base_index;
00054                         /* find the base x index and fractional offset from that        */
00055                         /*      if( intx < 0 ) { intx = 0; } else       */
00056                         if( intx > width - 2 ) { intx = width - 2; }
00057                         samplex -= intx;
00058                         /*      base index into the original image      */
00059                         base_index = (inty * width + intx) * channels;
00060             for ( c = 0; c < channels; ++c )
00061             {
00062                 /*      do the sampling */
00063                                 float value = 0.5f;
00064                                 value += orig[base_index]
00065                                                         *(1.0f-samplex)*(1.0f-sampley);
00066                                 value += orig[base_index+channels]
00067                                                         *(samplex)*(1.0f-sampley);
00068                                 value += orig[base_index+width*channels]
00069                                                         *(1.0f-samplex)*(sampley);
00070                                 value += orig[base_index+width*channels+channels]
00071                                                         *(samplex)*(sampley);
00072                                 /*      move to the next channel        */
00073                                 ++base_index;
00074                 /*      save the new value      */
00075                 resampled[y*resampled_width*channels+x*channels+c] =
00076                                                 (unsigned char)(value);
00077             }
00078         }
00079     }
00080     /*  done    */
00081     return 1;
00082 }
00083 
00084 int
00085         mipmap_image
00086         (
00087                 const unsigned char* const orig,
00088                 int width, int height, int channels,
00089                 unsigned char* resampled,
00090                 int block_size_x, int block_size_y
00091         )
00092 {
00093         int mip_width, mip_height;
00094         int i, j, c;
00095 
00096         /*      error check     */
00097         if( (width < 1) || (height < 1) ||
00098                 (channels < 1) || (orig == NULL) ||
00099                 (resampled == NULL) ||
00100                 (block_size_x < 1) || (block_size_y < 1) )
00101         {
00102                 /*      nothing to do   */
00103                 return 0;
00104         }
00105         mip_width = width / block_size_x;
00106         mip_height = height / block_size_y;
00107         if( mip_width < 1 )
00108         {
00109                 mip_width = 1;
00110         }
00111         if( mip_height < 1 )
00112         {
00113                 mip_height = 1;
00114         }
00115         for( j = 0; j < mip_height; ++j )
00116         {
00117                 for( i = 0; i < mip_width; ++i )
00118                 {
00119                         for( c = 0; c < channels; ++c )
00120                         {
00121                                 const int index = (j*block_size_y)*width*channels + (i*block_size_x)*channels + c;
00122                                 int sum_value;
00123                                 int u,v;
00124                                 int u_block = block_size_x;
00125                                 int v_block = block_size_y;
00126                                 int block_area;
00127                                 /*      do a bit of checking so we don't over-run the boundaries
00128                                         (necessary for non-square textures!)    */
00129                                 if( block_size_x * (i+1) > width )
00130                                 {
00131                                         u_block = width - i*block_size_y;
00132                                 }
00133                                 if( block_size_y * (j+1) > height )
00134                                 {
00135                                         v_block = height - j*block_size_y;
00136                                 }
00137                                 block_area = u_block*v_block;
00138                                 /*      for this pixel, see what the average
00139                                         of all the values in the block are.
00140                                         note: start the sum at the rounding value, not at 0     */
00141                                 sum_value = block_area >> 1;
00142                                 for( v = 0; v < v_block; ++v )
00143                                 for( u = 0; u < u_block; ++u )
00144                                 {
00145                                         sum_value += orig[index + v*width*channels + u*channels];
00146                                 }
00147                                 resampled[j*mip_width*channels + i*channels + c] = sum_value / block_area;
00148                         }
00149                 }
00150         }
00151         return 1;
00152 }

00154 int
00155         scale_image_RGB_to_NTSC_safe
00156         (
00157                 unsigned char* orig,
00158                 int width, int height, int channels
00159         )
00160 {
00161         const float scale_lo = 16.0f - 0.499f;
00162         const float scale_hi = 235.0f + 0.499f;
00163         int i, j;
00164         int nc = channels;
00165         unsigned char scale_LUT[256];
00166         /*      error check     */
00167         if( (width < 1) || (height < 1) ||
00168                 (channels < 1) || (orig == NULL) )
00169         {
00170                 /*      nothing to do   */
00171                 return 0;
00172         }
00173         /*      set up the scaling Look Up Table        */
00174         for( i = 0; i < 256; ++i )
00175         {
00176                 scale_LUT[i] = (unsigned char)((scale_hi - scale_lo) * i / 255.0f + scale_lo);
00177         }
00178         /*      for channels = 2 or 4, ignore the alpha component       */
00179         nc -= 1 - (channels & 1);
00180         /*      OK, go through the image and scale any non-alpha components     */
00181         for( i = 0; i < width*height*channels; i += channels )
00182         {
00183                 for( j = 0; j < nc; ++j )
00184                 {
00185                         orig[i+j] = scale_LUT[orig[i+j]];
00186                 }
00187         }
00188         return 1;
00189 }
00190 
00191 unsigned char clamp_byte( int x ) { return ( (x) < 0 ? (0) : ( (x) > 255 ? 255 : (x) ) ); }
00192 
00193 /*
00194         This function takes the RGB components of the image
00195         and converts them into YCoCg.  3 components will be
00196         re-ordered to CoYCg (for optimum DXT1 compression),
00197         while 4 components will be ordered CoCgAY (for DXT5
00198         compression).
00199 */
00200 int
00201         convert_RGB_to_YCoCg
00202         (
00203                 unsigned char* orig,
00204                 int width, int height, int channels
00205         )
00206 {
00207         int i;
00208         /*      error check     */
00209         if( (width < 1) || (height < 1) ||
00210                 (channels < 3) || (channels > 4) ||
00211                 (orig == NULL) )
00212         {
00213                 /*      nothing to do   */
00214                 return -1;
00215         }
00216         /*      do the conversion       */
00217         if( channels == 3 )
00218         {
00219                 for( i = 0; i < width*height*3; i += 3 )
00220                 {
00221                         int r = orig[i+0];
00222                         int g = (orig[i+1] + 1) >> 1;
00223                         int b = orig[i+2];
00224                         int tmp = (2 + r + b) >> 2;
00225                         /*      Co      */
00226                         orig[i+0] = clamp_byte( 128 + ((r - b + 1) >> 1) );
00227                         /*      Y       */
00228                         orig[i+1] = clamp_byte( g + tmp );
00229                         /*      Cg      */
00230                         orig[i+2] = clamp_byte( 128 + g - tmp );
00231                 }
00232         } else
00233         {
00234                 for( i = 0; i < width*height*4; i += 4 )
00235                 {
00236                         int r = orig[i+0];
00237                         int g = (orig[i+1] + 1) >> 1;
00238                         int b = orig[i+2];
00239                         unsigned char a = orig[i+3];
00240                         int tmp = (2 + r + b) >> 2;
00241                         /*      Co      */
00242                         orig[i+0] = clamp_byte( 128 + ((r - b + 1) >> 1) );
00243                         /*      Cg      */
00244                         orig[i+1] = clamp_byte( 128 + g - tmp );
00245                         /*      Alpha   */
00246                         orig[i+2] = a;
00247                         /*      Y       */
00248                         orig[i+3] = clamp_byte( g + tmp );
00249                 }
00250         }
00251         /*      done    */
00252         return 0;
00253 }

00255 /*
00256         This function takes the YCoCg components of the image
00257         and converts them into RGB.  See above.
00258 */
00259 int
00260         convert_YCoCg_to_RGB
00261         (
00262                 unsigned char* orig,
00263                 int width, int height, int channels
00264         )
00265 {
00266         int i;
00267         /*      error check     */
00268         if( (width < 1) || (height < 1) ||
00269                 (channels < 3) || (channels > 4) ||
00270                 (orig == NULL) )
00271         {
00272                 /*      nothing to do   */
00273                 return -1;
00274         }
00275         /*      do the conversion       */
00276         if( channels == 3 )
00277         {
00278                 for( i = 0; i < width*height*3; i += 3 )
00279                 {
00280                         int co = orig[i+0] - 128;
00281                         int y  = orig[i+1];
00282                         int cg = orig[i+2] - 128;
00283                         /*      R       */
00284                         orig[i+0] = clamp_byte( y + co - cg );
00285                         /*      G       */
00286                         orig[i+1] = clamp_byte( y + cg );
00287                         /*      B       */
00288                         orig[i+2] = clamp_byte( y - co - cg );
00289                 }
00290         } else
00291         {
00292                 for( i = 0; i < width*height*4; i += 4 )
00293                 {
00294                         int co = orig[i+0] - 128;
00295                         int cg = orig[i+1] - 128;
00296                         unsigned char a  = orig[i+2];
00297                         int y  = orig[i+3];
00298                         /*      R       */
00299                         orig[i+0] = clamp_byte( y + co - cg );
00300                         /*      G       */
00301                         orig[i+1] = clamp_byte( y + cg );
00302                         /*      B       */
00303                         orig[i+2] = clamp_byte( y - co - cg );
00304                         /*      A       */
00305                         orig[i+3] = a;
00306                 }
00307         }
00308         /*      done    */
00309         return 0;
00310 }
00311 
00312 float
00313 find_max_RGBE
00314 (
00315         unsigned char *image,
00316     int width, int height
00317 )
00318 {
00319         float max_val = 0.0f;
00320         unsigned char *img = image;
00321         int i, j;
00322         for( i = width * height; i > 0; --i )
00323         {
00324                 /* float scale = powf( 2.0f, img[3] - 128.0f ) / 255.0f; */
00325                 float scale = ldexp( 1.0f / 255.0f, (int)(img[3]) - 128 );
00326                 for( j = 0; j < 3; ++j )
00327                 {
00328                         if( img[j] * scale > max_val )
00329                         {
00330                                 max_val = img[j] * scale;
00331                         }
00332                 }
00333                 /* next pixel */
00334                 img += 4;
00335         }
00336         return max_val;
00337 }

00339 int
00340 RGBE_to_RGBdivA
00341 (
00342     unsigned char *image,
00343     int width, int height,
00344     int rescale_to_max
00345 )
00346 {
00347         /* local variables */
00348         int i, iv;
00349         unsigned char *img = image;
00350         float scale = 1.0f;
00351         /* error check */
00352         if( (!image) || (width < 1) || (height < 1) )
00353         {
00354                 return 0;
00355         }
00356         /* convert (note: no negative numbers, but 0.0 is possible) */
00357         if( rescale_to_max )
00358         {
00359                 scale = 255.0f / find_max_RGBE( image, width, height );
00360         }
00361         for( i = width * height; i > 0; --i )
00362         {
00363                 /* decode this pixel, and find the max */
00364                 float r,g,b,e, m;
00365                 /* e = scale * powf( 2.0f, img[3] - 128.0f ) / 255.0f; */
00366                 e = scale * ldexp( 1.0f / 255.0f, (int)(img[3]) - 128 );
00367                 r = e * img[0];
00368                 g = e * img[1];
00369                 b = e * img[2];
00370                 m = (r > g) ? r : g;
00371                 m = (b > m) ? b : m;
00372                 /* and encode it into RGBdivA */
00373                 iv = (m != 0.0f) ? (int)(255.0f / m) : 1.0f;
00374                 iv = (iv < 1) ? 1 : iv;
00375                 img[3] = (iv > 255) ? 255 : iv;
00376                 iv = (int)(img[3] * r + 0.5f);
00377                 img[0] = (iv > 255) ? 255 : iv;
00378                 iv = (int)(img[3] * g + 0.5f);
00379                 img[1] = (iv > 255) ? 255 : iv;
00380                 iv = (int)(img[3] * b + 0.5f);
00381                 img[2] = (iv > 255) ? 255 : iv;
00382                 /* and on to the next pixel */
00383                 img += 4;
00384         }
00385         return 1;
00386 }

00388 int
00389 RGBE_to_RGBdivA2
00390 (
00391     unsigned char *image,
00392     int width, int height,
00393     int rescale_to_max
00394 )
00395 {
00396         /* local variables */
00397         int i, iv;
00398         unsigned char *img = image;
00399         float scale = 1.0f;
00400         /* error check */
00401         if( (!image) || (width < 1) || (height < 1) )
00402         {
00403                 return 0;
00404         }
00405         /* convert (note: no negative numbers, but 0.0 is possible) */
00406         if( rescale_to_max )
00407         {
00408                 scale = 255.0f * 255.0f / find_max_RGBE( image, width, height );
00409         }
00410         for( i = width * height; i > 0; --i )
00411         {
00412                 /* decode this pixel, and find the max */
00413                 float r,g,b,e, m;
00414                 /* e = scale * powf( 2.0f, img[3] - 128.0f ) / 255.0f; */
00415                 e = scale * ldexp( 1.0f / 255.0f, (int)(img[3]) - 128 );
00416                 r = e * img[0];
00417                 g = e * img[1];
00418                 b = e * img[2];
00419                 m = (r > g) ? r : g;
00420                 m = (b > m) ? b : m;
00421                 /* and encode it into RGBdivA */
00422                 iv = (m != 0.0f) ? (int)sqrtf( 255.0f * 255.0f / m ) : 1.0f;
00423                 iv = (iv < 1) ? 1 : iv;
00424                 img[3] = (iv > 255) ? 255 : iv;
00425                 iv = (int)(img[3] * img[3] * r / 255.0f + 0.5f);
00426                 img[0] = (iv > 255) ? 255 : iv;
00427                 iv = (int)(img[3] * img[3] * g / 255.0f + 0.5f);
00428                 img[1] = (iv > 255) ? 255 : iv;
00429                 iv = (int)(img[3] * img[3] * b / 255.0f + 0.5f);
00430                 img[2] = (iv > 255) ? 255 : iv;
00431                 /* and on to the next pixel */
00432                 img += 4;
00433         }
00434         return 1;
00435 }
